alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 16 at 12:14AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Franklin and central Crawford Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1213 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 3 miles southwest of Mountainburg, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Ozark... Mountainburg... Mulberry... Dyer... Rudy... Wiederkehr Village... Lake Fort Smith... Fern... Jethro... Barnes... Watalula... Meg... Piney... Toney... Cecil... Lonelm... Cravens... Paradise... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 15 and 38. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
